Package com.millicast

Class VideoSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.millicast.Source
      • com.millicast.VideoSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Source.CaptureSource
    public class VideoSource
extends Source
implements Source.CaptureSource
    The VideoSource class can start a video capture

      • changeCaptureFormat

        public void changeCaptureFormat​(VideoCapabilities cap)
        Dynamically change the video capture format once the capture is started
        Parameters:
        cap - The new video capture format
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the capture is not started

      • changeCaptureFormat

        public void changeCaptureFormat​(int width,
                                int height,
                                int fps)
        Dynamically change the video capture format once the capture is started
        Parameters:
        width - The new width
        height - The new height
        fps - The new fps
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the capture is not started

      • switchCamera

        public void switchCamera​(VideoSource.SwitchCameraHandler handler)
        Switch to another camera device when capturing
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler object to receive events from the switch
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the capture is not started
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the source's type is not a device

      • switchCamera

        public void switchCamera​(VideoSource.SwitchCameraHandler handler,
                         java.lang.String name)
        Switch to another camera device when capturing
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler object to receive events from the switch
        name - To switch to a specific device
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the capture is not started
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the source's type is not a device

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters​(android.hardware.Camera.Parameters parameters)
        Set the camera parameters for Camera1 api, once the capture is started
        Parameters:
        parameters - The parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the capture was started using the Camera2 api
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the capture was not started

      • getParameters

        public android.hardware.Camera.Parameters getParameters()
        Get the camera parameters for Camera1 api, once the capture is started
        Returns:
        parameters The parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the capture was started using the Camera2 api
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the capture was not started
